snippet: Dictators will continue to hide their ill-gotten riches in America unless we close corporate loopholes that allow them to easily launder money.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Ken Silverstein, a contributing editor at Harper's Magazine, applauds the Justice Department for filing a complaint against Teodorin Obiang, the son and heir apparent of Equatorial Guinea's dictator Teodoro Obaing Nguema Mbasogo, detailing allegations of bribery and money-laundering; contends the case shows how America is the premier destination for foreign despots' ill-gotten riches and calls on Congress to close corporate loopholes that encourage such practices.
lead_paragraph: Dictators will continue to hide their ill-gotten riches in America unless we close corporate loopholes that allow them to easily launder money.

headline.main: Keep the Dictators Out of Malibu
headline.print_headline: Keep the Dictators Out of Malibu
